engine

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as the engine of the game. It handles storing, creating, and removing objects, collision, and organized shooting and moving.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ENDLESS_MODE 
      java.lang.String gameMode 
      GameWindow gameWindow 
      static java.lang.String LIMITED_MODE 
      static int LOST 
      static int STILL_GOING 
      static int WON 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine(GameWindow gameWindow, int numberOfEnemies)
      This constructor creates a game in the given window with the given number of enemies and in the default game mode Limited.
      GameEngine(GameWindow gameWindow, int numberOfEnemies, java.lang.String gameMode)
      This constructor creates a game in the given window with the given number of enemies and in the specified game mode It creates ArrayLists with initial estimations of size and creates a player and spawn enemies.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(GameWindow gameWindow,
                  int numberOfEnemies,
                  java.lang.String gameMode)
        This constructor creates a game in the given window with the given number of enemies and in the specified game mode It creates ArrayLists with initial estimations of size and creates a player and spawn enemies. It also notifies the window of the game objects list and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        gameWindow - the window containing the panel the game is drawn on
        numberOfEnemies - the number of enemies or intial enemies
        gameMode - the game mode the game is played in

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(GameWindow gameWindow,
                  int numberOfEnemies)
        This constructor creates a game in the given window with the given number of enemies and in the default game mode Limited. It does the same as the other constructor
        Parameters:
        gameWindow - the window containing the panel the game is drawn on
        numberOfEnemies - the number of enemies or intial enemies

    • Method Detail

      • addGameObject

        public void addGameObject(AbstractGameObject gameObject)
        This method adds a game object to the appropriate list.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - the game object

      • addBullet

        public void addBullet(Shooter shooter)
        This method creates a bullet with a given shooter and then adds it to the game objects.
        Parameters:
        shooter - the shooter of the bullet

      • getGameObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<AbstractGameObject> getGameObjects()
        This method returns the game objects list.
        Returns:
        returns game objects list

      • getPlayer

        public PlayerShip getPlayer()
        This method return the palyer.
        Returns:
        returns the player

      • update

        public void update()
        This method updates the game. It lets te shooters shoot. The movers move. Checks collisions. And removes the dead objects.

      • checkEndCondition

        public int checkEndCondition()
        This method checks the state of the win/lose conditions for the current mode
        Returns:
        returns -1 if the player lost, 0 if the game is still going, and 1 if the player won

      • manDown

        public void manDown(AbstractGameObject deadObject)
        The method is called by an object if it's dead. It adds it to the dead objects list. If the object is an enemy ship it increases the kill count.
        Parameters:
        deadObject - the dead object

      • getKillCount

        public int getKillCount()
        This method returns the kill count.
        Returns:
        returns the number of enemy ships killed

      • notifyWindowOfObjects

        public void notifyWindowOfObjects()
        This method passes the game objects to the window.

      • notifyWindowOfPlayer

        public void notifyWindowOfPlayer()
        This method passes the player to the window.

      • notifyObjectsOfWindow

        public void notifyObjectsOfWindow()
        This method passes the game window (actually game panel) to a static reference in AbstractGameObject to be used by all game objects.

      • getGameWindow

        public GameWindow.GamePanel getGameWindow()
        This method returns the actual game panel. We pretend to deal with game window for simplicity.
        Returns:
        returns the actual game panel.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        This method is called when game is over. It removes and clears all lists. And passes the final score to GameTier
